Start a chat for the given user.

Returns false if the user could not login.

00233

void SimpleChatWidget::processChatEvent ( const ChatEvent &  event  )  [private]

Definition at line 245 of file SimpleChatWidget.C.

00246 {
00247   /*
00248    * This is where the "server-push" happens. This method is called
00249    * when a new event or message needs to be notified to the user. In
00250    * general, it is called from another session.
00251    */
00252 
00253   /*
00254    * First, take the lock to safely manipulate the UI outside of the
00255    * normal event loop, by having exclusive access to the session.
00256    */
00257   WApplication::UpdateLock lock = app_->getUpdateLock();
00258 
00259   /*
00260    * Format and append the line to the conversation.
00261    *
00262    * This is also the step where the automatic XSS filtering will kick in:
00263    * - if another user tried to pass on some JavaScript, it is filtered away.
00264    * - if another user did not provide valid XHTML, the text is automatically
00265    *   interpreted as PlainText
00266    */
00267   bool needPush = false;
00268 
00269   /*
00270    * If it is not a normal message, also update the user list.
00271    */
00272   if (event.type() != ChatEvent::Message) {
00273     needPush = true;
00274     updateUsers();
00275   }
00276 
00277   bool display = event.type() != ChatEvent::Message
00278     || (users_.find(event.user()) != users_.end() && users_[event.user()]);
00279 
00280   if (display) {
00281     needPush = true;
00282 
00283     WText *w = new WText(event.formattedHTML(user_), messages_);
00284     w->setInline(false);
00285     w->setStyleClass("chat-msg");
00286 
00287     /*
00288      * Leave not more than 100 messages in the back-log
00289      */
00290     if (messages_->count() > 100)
00291       delete messages_->children()[0];
00292 
00293     /*
00294      * Little javascript trick to make sure we scroll along with new content
00295      */
00296     app_->doJavaScript(messages_->jsRef() + ".scrollTop += "
00297                        + messages_->jsRef() + ".scrollHeight;");
00298 
00299     /* If this message belongs to another user, play a received sound */
00300     if (event.user() != user_)
00301       messageReceived_.play();
00302   }
00303 
00304   if (needPush)
00305     app_->triggerUpdate();
00306 }
